titlestmt.titleproper: Pacific University and Tualatin Academy Student Registration Log Books 1887-1912
Pacific University and Tualatin Academy Student Registration Log Books
titlestmt.author: Eva Guggemos
titlestmt.sponsor: Sponsored by a grant from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-05-30.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

did.unittitle: Pacific University and Tualatin Academy Student Registration Log Books
did.abstract: This collection consists of student registration records from Pacific University and its associated high school, Tualatin Academy. The records are in two log books dating from 1877-1883 and 1891-1912.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of student registration records from Pacific University and its associated high school, Tualatin Academy. Two log books are included. Both contain information such as students' names, enrollment dates, parents' names, home towns, addresses, grades and absences. The log books date from 1877-1883 and 1891-1912.

bioghist.p: Pacific University is located in Forest Grove, Oregon. It formerly had an associated high school, Tualatin Academy, which was active from 1849-1914. Between at least the late 1800s and the early 1900s, records of students' registrations and grades were compiled in handwritten log books. Information from these log books was probably the source of the rolls of students which were printed in the annual university Catalogues.

scopecontent.p: This ledger book is organized chronologically, listing students enrolled at Pacific University and Tualatin Academy for each academic year. The students' names, parents' names, home town, local address, age, date of entry, coursework, absences and grades are included in some terms.
A registration log organized chronologically. Includes students' name, courses taken and grade received, age, names of parent/guardian and home town.
